required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Vegetable Signature From Human Metabolomics Responses
clinical_study.official_title: Dietary Intervention Studies on a Variety of Vegetables

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to perform dietary intervention studies on a variety of vegetables.

detailed_description.textblock: Plant-based foods have always been an important component of a healthy diet. High intake of plant foods may not only maintain normal bodily functions through the provision of dietary fiber, vitamins, and minerals but also relieve symptoms and prevent diseases. Many studies have pointed out that high intake of plant foods may reduce the incidence of non-communicable disease. Past research investigating the effect of phytochemicals has usually been limited to single substances or single foods. However, a number of researchers have pointed out that phytonutrients and dietary components are likely to act synergistically.Health effects and mechanisms of phytonutrients in combination have not been carefully studied in population settings. The technology of metabolomics has enabled the simultaneous measurement of hundreds of small molecules in biological samples. Exploring the change of metabolites after feeding can not only help us understand the role of plant foods, but may also provide opportunities to assess plant food intake levels.

primary_outcome.description: The outcome measure consists of intensities of multiple serum metabolites from a liquid chromatography/time-of-flight/mass spectrometry (LC/TOF/MS) experiment. Intensity means the level of response variable (a given metabolite) showing the degree of response detected by LC/TOF/MS.

The outcome measure consists of intensities of multiple urinary metabolites from a liquid chromatography/time-of-flight/mass spectrometry (LC/TOF/MS) experiment. Intensity means the level of response variable (a given metabolite) showing the degree of response detected by LC/TOF/MS.

primary_outcome.time_frame: 3.5~4 hours (before lunch urine sample collected during 11:00~11:30AM)
primary_outcome.description: The outcome measure consists of intensities of multiple urinary metabolites from a liquid chromatography/time-of-flight/mass spectrometry (LC/TOF/MS) experiment. Intensity means the level of response variable (a given metabolite) showing the degree of response detected by LC/TOF/MS.

primary_outcome.time_frame: 4.5~6.5 hours (2-hour after lunch urine sample collected from 12:00 to 14:00PM)
primary_outcome.description: The outcome measure consists of intensities of multiple urinary metabolites from a liquid chromatography/time-of-flight/mass spectrometry (LC/TOF/MS) experiment. Intensity means the level of response variable (a given metabolite) showing the degree of response detected by LC/TOF/MS.

primary_outcome.time_frame: 6.5~8.5 hours (4-hour after lunch urine sample collected from 14:00 to 16:00PM)
primary_outcome.description: The outcome measure consists of intensities of multiple urinary metabolites from a liquid chromatography/time-of-flight/mass spectrometry (LC/TOF/MS) experiment. Intensity means the level of response variable (a given metabolite) showing the degree of response detected by LC/TOF/MS.

primary_outcome.time_frame: 8.5~11.5 hours (7-hour after lunch urine sample collected from 16:00 to 19:00PM)
primary_outcome.description: The outcome measure consists of intensities of multiple urinary metabolites from a liquid chromatography/time-of-flight/mass spectrometry (LC/TOF/MS) experiment. Intensity means the level of response variable (a given metabolite) showing the degree of response detected by LC/TOF/MS.

clinical_study.condition: Vegetable Signature Documentation With Metabolomic Technique

arm_group.description: Participants were fed a standardized diet (without any vegetables) in this experiment.
Participants were fed a standardized diet with 200g spinach in this experiment.
Participants were fed a standardized diet with 200g celery in this experiment.
Participants were fed a standardized diet with 200g onion in this experiment.
Participants were fed a standardized diet with 200g of mixed vegetables (spinach, celery, and onion) in this experiment.

intervention.description: A standardized diet without any vegetables was provided.
A standardized diet with 200g spinach was provided.
A standardized diet with 200g celery was provided.
A standardized diet with 200g onion was provided.
A standardized diet with 200g of mixed vegetables (spinach, celery, and onion) was provided.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- BMI 18.5~30 kg/m2
- non-smoker
- non-alcoholic
Exclusion Criteria:
- Unwilling to stop taking the dietary supplements that may affect the experiment result.
- Unwilling to take the provided meal during the designated period.
- Taking hypertension or diabetes drugs.
- Diagnosed immune diseases (such as allergic diseases, autoimmune diseases, etc.), liver diseases, metabolic diseases (such as hyperthyroidism or hypothyroidism), or other not suitable for the dietary study.
- Diagnosed cancer or other severe diseases.
- Suffered from urinary tract infection or took antibiotic in the past three months
